PHASE 1: Workspace & Environment Setup

**Explanations:**
Inihahanda ng phase na ito ang iyong local workspace. Kabilang dito ang pag-update ng system packages, pag-install ng tamang Python version, pag-create ng isang isolated virtual environment, at pag-install ng mga pangunahing dependencies na kakailanganin para sa mga susunod na hakbang.

**Technical Artifacts / Tasks:**

**1. I-update ang System at Mag-install ng Python venv:**
Siguraduhing up-to-date ang iyong system at naka-install ang `venv` package para sa iyong Python version.
```bash
sudo apt update
sudo apt install python3.13-venv python3.13-full
# Palitan ang python3.13 base sa version mo; pwede rin python3-venv lang
```

**2. Gumawa at I-activate ang Virtual Environment:**
Lilikha ito ng isang `venv` folder sa iyong kasalukuyang directory at ia-activate ito para maging isolated ang iyong mga dependencies.
```bash
# Gumawa ng bagong virtual environment sa workspace
python3 -m venv venv

# Activate ang virtual environment
source venv/bin/activate
# Makikita mo (venv) sa simula ng prompt kapag naka-activate
```

**3. I-upgrade ang Pip at I-install ang Core Tools:**
I-install ang mga mahahalagang Python packages na gagamitin sa buong proseso.
```bash
# I-upgrade ang pip at install ang mga kinakailangang packages
pip install --upgrade pip setuptools wheel
pip install grpcio-tools pytest
```

PHASE 2: Tutoring Agents Merge

**Explanations:**
This phase executes a one-shot script to consolidate the `TutorAgent` and `TutoringAgent` into a single, unified `TutoringServiceAgent`. It involves copying the new implementation, performing a complex refactoring of the PC2 startup configuration, and running multiple checks to ensure system integrity.

**Technical Artifacts / Tasks:**

**1. Copy Unified Agent Implementation (1/7):**
Copy the backup implementation of the new agent to its final destination.

```bash
echo "ğŸ“ 1/7  Copying unified agent implementation..."
SRC="pc2_code/agents/backups/tutoring_service_agent.py"
DST="pc2_code/agents/TutoringServiceAgent.py"
cp "$SRC" "$DST"
```

**2. Refactor PC2 Startup Configuration (2/7):**
Execute a Python script to modify `pc2_code/config/startup_config.yaml`. This script will remove old agent entries, add the new one, update dependencies across all other services, and adjust the Docker group.

```bash
echo "ğŸ—‚ 2/7  Refactoring pc2 startup_config.yaml..."
python3 - <<'PY'
import yaml, pathlib, textwrap, re, sys

CFG = pathlib.Path("pc2_code/config/startup_config.yaml")
data = yaml.safe_load(CFG.read_text())

# 2-A  Remove TutorAgent & TutoringAgent from pc2_services list
old_names = {"TutorAgent", "TutoringAgent"}
svc_list = data.get("pc2_services", [])
svc_list = [svc for svc in svc_list if svc.get("name") not in old_names]

# 2-B  Add TutoringServiceAgent (if not yet present)
agent_name = "TutoringServiceAgent"
if not any(s.get("name") == agent_name for s in svc_list):
    svc_list.append({
        "name": agent_name,
        "script_path": "pc2_code/agents/TutoringServiceAgent.py",
        "host": "0.0.0.0",
        "port": "${PORT_OFFSET}+7108",
        "health_check_port": "${PORT_OFFSET}+8108",
        "required": True,
        "dependencies": ["MemoryOrchestratorService"]
    })
data["pc2_services"] = svc_list

# 2-C  Sweep through every serviceâ€™s dependencies and
#      replace TutorAgent / TutoringAgent with new name.
for svc in data["pc2_services"]:
    deps = svc.get("dependencies", [])
    svc["dependencies"] = [
        agent_name if d in old_names else d for d in deps
    ]

# 2-D  Update docker_groups.tutoring_cpu
dg = data.setdefault("docker_groups", {})
tgrp = dg.setdefault("tutoring_cpu", {
    "description": "Tutoring and educational agents (CPU-bound)",
    "agents": []
})
agents = set(tgrp.get("agents", [])) - old_names
agents.add(agent_name)
tgrp["agents"] = sorted(agents)

CFG.write_text(textwrap.dedent(yaml.dump(data, sort_keys=False)))
print("startup_config.yaml patched âœ”")
PY
```

**3. Run Import Test (3/7):**
Perform a direct import test on the new agent file to ensure it's syntactically valid and contains the expected class.

```bash
echo "ğŸ§ª 3/7  Import test for TutoringServiceAgent..."
python3 - <<'PY'
import importlib.util, pathlib, sys
path = pathlib.Path("pc2_code/agents/TutoringServiceAgent.py")
spec = importlib.util.spec_from_file_location("TutoringServiceAgent", path)
module = importlib.util.module_from_spec(spec)
spec.loader.exec_module(module)
assert hasattr(module, "TutoringServiceAgent") or hasattr(module, "TutorAgent"), \
       "Agent class not found"
print("Import OK âœ”")
PY
```

**4. Remove Stale Files (4/7):**
Clean up any lingering `.pyc` build artifacts.

```bash
echo "ğŸ§¹ 4/7  Removing stale files (if any build artefacts)â€¦"
find pc2_code/agents -name "*.pyc" -delete
```

**5. YAML Validity Check (5/7):**
Validate that the heavily modified `startup_config.yaml` is still a valid YAML file.

```bash
echo "ğŸ“œ 5/7  YAML validity check..."
python3 - <<'PY'
import yaml, pathlib
yaml.safe_load(pathlib.Path("pc2_code/config/startup_config.yaml").read_text())
print("startup_config.yaml valid YAML âœ”")
PY
```

**6. Run Pytest Stub (6/7):**
Create and run a minimal pytest test case for the new agent.

```bash
echo "ğŸ§ª 6/7  Running minimal pytest stub..."
python3 -m pip install --quiet pytest
cat > tests/test_tutoring_service_import.py <<'PYT'
def test_import():
    import importlib.util, pathlib
    p = pathlib.Path("pc2_code/agents/TutoringServiceAgent.py")
    spec = importlib.util.spec_from_file_location("TutoringServiceAgent", p)
    m = importlib.util.module_from_spec(spec); spec.loader.exec_module(m)
PYT
pytest -q
```
